abstract: President Obama’s latest plan to bolster the economy, a $275 billion housing relief measure announced earlier this week, has run into considerable skepticism on Wall Street. While the specifics of the plan are still up in the air — more information is due out on March 4 — analysts have tried to piece together what kind of affect it could have on stabilizing housing prices.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s latest plan to bolster the economy, a $275 billion housing relief measure announced earlier this week, has run into considerable skepticism on Wall Street. While the specifics of the plan are still up in the air — more information is due out on March 4 — analysts have tried to piece together what kind of affect it could have on stabilizing housing prices.

headline.main: Citi Sees Obama’s Housing Plan Falling Short
